page.title: 04Legend of Saint Keyna.
page.content: St. Keyna was a beautiful 5th Century British princess. She left her father's court in Wales and came to England. She came to Keynsham and decided that she would stay. She found out from a person who lived in the village that there were serpents in the village. Each serpent she saw she turned into stone. Local people used to think that the coiled-up shapes found in rocks were the remains of the serpents. In fact they are the fossilised remains of ammonites, creatures which lived in the sea about 50 million years ago. The fossils were often used for decoration in the walls of houses in Keynsham. Some people claim that Keynsham takes its name from the legend of St. Keyna.
